UnitType.Description: Capable of settling new cities, as well as creating or upgrading outposts. They're also pretty good at dying if you leave them undefended.
Fast units meant for exploring the world and running away from its dangers.
A scout with a majestic white horse. Moves faster and sees further, thanks to that majestic white horse.
Basic short range combat unit. Can use their shields to bash enemy units back in combat.
A more vicious variant of the Pikeman. Can use their pikes to impale multiple foes in a line.
A ferocious wolf and faithful companion.
Basic short range combat unit. Can use their shields to bash enemy units back in combat.
Armored unit designed to enforce your will across the lands.
NOT USED
A highly trained man at arms.
Basic short range combat unit. Can use their pikes to impale multiple foes in a line.
A more vicious variant of the Pikeman. Can use their pikes to impale multiple foes in a line.
Basic ranged combat unit. Does not fare well in hand to hand fighting.
Can perform a special ranged attack with 100% accuracy. [Only available to the Guardian]
Mounted soldiers, much faster than other units. [Only available to the 'Commander' Sovereign]
A more advanced mounted unit. Stronger, faster, and capable of knocking enemy units down.
A cunning warrior that does double damage against unholy units. Can move around stealthily, and backstab units with no armor.
A magic-based unit capable of healing friendly units. A bit self righteous, but you'll be glad she's around.
A magic-based unit capable of hurling deadly spells at enemies from a distance. Probably best to stay on her good side.
A mage who's still learning. Keep him away from the scary monsters so he can enchant from a distance.
An enormously powerful being. Oh, and it flies.
A powerful holy unit mounted on a Drake, capable of healing friendly units and doing massive damage to the undead.
A civilian capable of increasing a city's growth when stationed there. Not much use in a fight.
A civilian capable of increasing a city's logistics when stationed there. Not much use in a fight.
A glorious golden dragon capable of breathing fire. Aim away from face.
Arctic Wolf cubs are insatiably curious, and often accompany Dwarves on their adventures.
A fully grown and trained Arctic Wolf is nearly as dangerous as the Dwarven warrior it is surely accompanying.
A dragon from the frozen lands of the north. Ferocious in battle, and famously unruly, only the wisest of Dwarf Lords know the secrets of taming them.
A Darkling scout - worthless in battle, but not so worthless when tasked with exploration.
Former laborers from the Sorcerer King's empire, capable of building Cities and Outposts. Not that bad in a fight either.
Former laborers from the Sorcerer King's empire, capable of building Cities and Outposts. Not that bad in a fight either.
A fragment of the soul of Naphaz. Transparent, but just as mean.
Cheap, unskilled, disposable knights - forced to fight by the will of their sovereign.
Swift and dangerous beasts, full of teeth and ill will.
Swift and dangerous beasts, full of teeth and ill will.
Trained to be the backbone of the Sorcerer King's army, Trogs are capable and dangerous warriors.
Bound to a greater power, this Fallen has an unstable gift of channeling, capable of confusing or damaging enemies at a distance.
The twisted, cursed soul of a fallen foe.
A powerful channeller, one of the greatest the world has ever seen. He wields a variety of offensive and defensive spells and can hypnotise enemy units, instantly changing the course of a battle.
UnitType.Backstory: A powerful channeller, one of the greatest the world has ever seen. He wields a variety of offensive and defensive spells and can hypnotise enemy units, instantly changing the course of a battle.

UnitType.Description:
A great general, trained from birth in all aspects of martial life.
He is able to amass great armies and lead them over vast distances in little time. His cities are built with one priority: to train the world's most powerful army.
UnitType.Backstory:
A great general, trained from birth in all aspects of martial life.
He is able to amass great armies and lead them over vast distances in little time. His cities are built with one priority: to train the world's most powerful army.

UnitType.Description: A cruel and callous leader who will stop at nothing to overthrow the Sorcerer King. Equally unforgiving with his own subjects, the Tyrant draws strength from the Doomsday timer, gaining magic, production, and military might as the world slips into darkness.
UnitType.Backstory: A cruel and callous leader who will stop at nothing to overthrow the Sorcerer King. Equally unforgiving with his own subjects, the Tyrant draws strength from the Doomsday timer, gaining magic, production, and military might as the world slips into darkness.

UnitType.Description: A talented mage with a strange and unique connection to the world itself. The powerful earth magic she wields can shape the land, expand her borders, or protect her armies.
UnitType.Backstory:
A talented mage with a strange and unique connection to the world itself.
The powerful earth magic she wields can shape the land, expand her borders, or protect her armies.

UnitType.Description:
A legendary healer and scholar with a connection to the divine.
Her prayers can call down the power of the gods - spells of unequaled healing or destructive power.
UnitType.Backstory:
A legendary healer and scholar with a connection to the divine.
Her prayers can call down the power of the gods - spells of unequaled healing or destructive power.

UnitType.Description: A master craftsman who spent much of his life studying the Forge of the Overlord. He now wields it with great skill, benefiting all the soldiers and servants of his realm.
UnitType.Backstory: A master craftsman who spent much of his life studying the Forge of the Overlord. He now wields it with great skill, benefiting all the soldiers and servants of his realm.

UnitType.Description: A dark and twisted figure who seeks to subjugate all living beings. Of unknown origin, though some say he was once a man.
UnitType.Quote: TXT_UNIT_BLACKSORCERER_QUOTE

UnitType.Description: A guardian of the once great Paridenian Kingdom. Tough, but a bit slow.
A mystic of the once great Paridenian Kingdom. Arrogant, as most beings that can shoot lightning from their hands are.
Quendar Archers are famed for their keen eyesight, and fearsome skills with a bow.
The most experienced of Quendar archers get a fancy new title, and can hit even harder.
Krax Savagers are known for, amongst other things, their savagery.
Elite Krax Spearmen, capable of bringing cavalry to its knees.
A summoned spirit, capable of healing surrounding units. Good for what ails you.
A dark and twisted figure who seeks to subjugate all living beings. A mortal, for now. But he's trying to change that.
A wily creature of the shadows. They die easily, but can swap places with your units, disrupting your formations.
Stronger than a normal darkling, but that's not saying much.
Laborers in the Sorcerer King's empire, capable of building Strongholds. Not that bad in a fight either.
There are some Urxen wiser than the others, it seems. This is one of them.
The backbone of the Sorcerer King's army, capable and dangerous warriors.
The presence of a Trog Commander can sway an entire battle. Their battle cry lets all enemy units take a free turn. Take him out quickly.
The basic ranged unit of the Sorcerer King's army. Deals death from a distance with their 'Snipe' ability.
The upgraded ranged unit of the Sorcerer King's army. Deals death from a distance with their also upgraded 'Snipe' ability.
Swift and dangerous beasts, full of teeth and ill will.
Only a fool would place himself atop the shoulders of a Warg. Sadly, the Sorcerer King has many such fools at his disposal. Fast and deadly, so have pikemen at the ready.
A Fallen with the gift of channeling, capable of confusing or damaging enemies at a distance.
A massive and incredibly destructive monster, capable of crushing all enemies before it. Often the enemies behind it as well.
A horrible creature that's stepped out of a nightmare. Capable of casting enormously destructive magic.
A terrible beast, the product of horrible experiments by the Sorcerer King's forces, capable of devouring enemy units whole.
A massively powerful warrior, shackled and driven mad by the Sorcerer King before being set upon the enemy.
A ferocious wolf that seems to prefer the company of Bandits. A bit meaner than Bandits. A bit stinkier too.
A wolf that other wolves are afraid of.
You wouldn't enjoy any wolf biting you, but you'd enjoy it quite a bit less if it was this one.
A dangerous pack of 6 wolves, 24 legs, 96 claws, or 288 teeth. However you size them up - this beastly pack knows how to make things bleed.
Basic short range thug. Not very smart. Not very dangerous.
An experienced bandit that will call his faithful wolf to the battle if it's taking too long. That's a neat trick.
Lord of the bandits. Can call an alpha wolf into battle.
A bandit with a bow. Maybe he doesn't like getting his hands dirty.
Experience bandit archers, equipped with fire-tipped arrows.
Experience bandit archers, equipped with fire-tipped arrows.
The Bandit Archer Party - a 'good at killing from afar' kind of group.
A bandit on a horse, essentially. Fast, and dangerous when attacking from the flanks.
An experienced barbarian atop an experienced horse. He's ruined many days in his time, and is fully capable of ruining yours.
NOT USED
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: One small spider isn't scary. Unfortunately, they rarely come in packs of one.
A shockingly big spider. Just way too big. Capable of capturing enemy units in its web.
An ancient spider of ancient strength and ancient hunger. Loves eating soldiers. Reportedly, the soldiers aren't too fond of it.
A monsterous bear that can maul its foes. It can maul anyone it wants, really. It just only wants to maul its foes.
A skeleton reanimated by an unknown magic. Not very tough, but creepy as hell.
A skeleton animated with stronger magic and possibly a few extra bones. More femurs make these a force to contend with.
A very fast cat-like creature. A remorseless hunter, capable of mauling enemy units.
A swamp cat with unmatched speed and reflexes. Has an aversion to magic, but an affinity to clawing your entire face off.
A massive green Ogre, as unfriendly as it is large. Will throw stones at any who try to escape the reach of his club.
An older, wiser, smellier Ogre. Its advanced age hasn't reduced its appetite for hurling boulders.
This deadly Drake cub bonded with you the moment it emerged from its egg.
A dragon like creature with lots of teeth. And claws. And teeth. Claws again. It's just covered in pointy bits, basically.
There's nothing up his sleevesexcept death! Casts powerful spells from a distance, but quick to fall to the sword.
Swampland beasts known as Garrotes. Often in the company of bandits.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: A being of stone and soil, brought into existence by some form of dark magic.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: Magic weilding Ogres are rare but deadly, changing the shape of battle by changing the size of units.
A former guardsman of the kingdom, now selling their services to the highest bidder.
A man at arms working for a criminal organization. Such villains thrive during times of social upheaval.
It is rare to observe a Syndicate Assassin out of the shadows.
Dabbles in death magic. Not someone you'll want to spend much time around.
A dark elf capable of manipulating the dark arts. A night person, probably. Also a master of inflicting pain.
Has healed many people in her time. Too many. Something snapped, and now needs healing herself.
Imperial archers that fled their posts when the Sorcerer King arrived. Don't mistake this cowardice for weakness.
Former guardsmen of the Imperium. Utterly merciless when fighting mounted units.
Wild emberling occasionally explode upon death. Approach with caution. Or, not at all.
The Dwarves don't trust magic and those who practice it are often exiled.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: A handsome bird, capable of scouting over oceans and mountains.

UnitTypes.UnitType:
Ship Ship An unarmed sailing vessel, a living remnant of an age when man had mastered the seas. 0 1 0 75 15 8 3 8 4
Unit_Ship_Portrait.png

UnitType.Description: A firey looking character, capable of channeling firey magic.
A small beetle-like creature, made largely out of fire. Wear gloves when handling.
A very large, very dangerous fire monster, capable of wielding destructive magic.
A Fire Elemental which has seen much in its time. If it even feels time.
A dragon like creature with lots of teeth. This one seems to like warm weather. And biting.
This lieutenant of the Sorcerer King can bathe an entire army in flames.
Swamp Spiders are merciless beasts that leave pools of poisonous blood when killed.
Not the brightest bloke. But at his size, he doesn't need to be.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: A Swamp Giant a bit dumber than average, but with additional training at swinging things.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: A Dwarf with a crossbow on a spider. It doesn't sound like it should work, but it does, quite well.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: A dwarven fighter, small in stature, yet filled with more fighting spirit than combatants twice its size.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: A dwarven fighter, still pretty small, but filled with even more fighting spirit.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: Still not very big, but positively overflowing with fighting spirit. Some of it's getting on his beard in fact.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: One of the few Dwarven Mages trusted by his Kinsmen. Probably enchanted them in fact. They're distrusted for a reason.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: A massive, fur covered beast from the frozen north. Loves cold. Hates fire. A little stinky. Some matted fur.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: A mighty Yeti commander. Can rile other Yeti up, inducing a battle fever.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: The wisest of Yeti warriors have learned the secrets of casting Ice Magic.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: An elemental being composed of ice. Fairly weak against physical attacks but quick to hit with powerful ice spells.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: A tiny being made of ice. Shatters easily, but can freeze his attackers on death. The wise strike from afar.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: A dragon like creature with lots of teeth. This one seems to like cold weather. And biting.
A chilling looking character, capable of channeling chilling magic.
Made of the fused bones of the long fallen, Wraiths are a terror we had hoped was long extinct.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: The enchanted bones of slain creatures, Wraithlings are capable of terrible damage.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: This lieutenant of the Sorcerer King can bathe an entire army in ice.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: Ice Elementals freeze adjacent foes when summoned into battle.
UnitType.Quote: That odor isn't mewellfine, yesit's me.

UnitType.Description: Fire Elementals burn adjacent foes when summoned into battle.
Summoned Shadow Wargs strike fear in adjacent foes when summoned into battle.
Air Elementals shock adjacent enemies when summoned into battle, disabling their special abilities for two rounds.
An Assassin Demon boosts the combat speed of allies, and can move immediately upon being summoned.
Summoned Imps are weak but wily, and can refresh their moves whenever struck in battle.
A Colossus wrought from fire and ash, summoned into battle. These haven't been seen since ages long forgotten.
A summoned bear that can maul its foes. It can maul anyone it wants, really. It just only wants to maul its foes.
An ancient critter as ugly as it is deadly. Can bash enemies around the battlefield.
A summoned beast that can entangle enemies in its poisonous web.
NOT USED
A massive summoned beast, the one time guardian of a long forgotten civilization.
Iron Golems boost the defense of all adjacent friendly units when summoned in battle.
A massive summoned beast, the one time guardian of a long forgotten civilization.
The answer to a prayer for help on the battlefield.
A summoned blade, crafted from the earth and infused with mana. Capable of Cleaving up to 3 adjacent enemies.
A summoned spear, crafted with mana and capable of Impaling a row of enemies.
A summoned Bow and Quiver, crafted with mana and capable of hitting enemies from afar.
A summoned creature of stone and magic. They will fight at your side until said magic fizzles out.
Beware of the underdogs! They may not be strong, but they are many.
A ferocious pack of wolves, trained to come when the Beast Lord calls.
A pack of monsterous bears that can maul the enemies of their master - the Beast Lord.
The Paridenian's have cobbled together enough supplies to settle new lands. Hopefully the Sorcerer King dosen't find out.
The Yetis have cobbled together enough supplies to settle new lands. Hopefully the Sorcerer King dosen't find out.
The Dwarves have cobbled together enough supplies to settle new lands. Hopefully the Sorcerer King dosen't find out.
The Swamp Giants have cobbled together enough supplies to settle new lands. Hopefully the Sorcerer King dosen't find out.
The Imperium have cobbled together enough supplies to settle new lands. Hopefully the Sorcerer King dosen't find out.
The Wraiths have cobbled together enough supplies to settle new lands. Hopefully the Sorcerer King dosen't find out.
The Keepers of the Flame have cobbled together enough supplies to settle new lands. Hopefully the Sorcerer King dosen't find out.
